contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your enemies will defeat you because I will not be with you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for I will not be with you, and you will be defeated by your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People also consider that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That also is considered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh put all of Og's people under our control" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all his people were put under our control

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not ... and do not let anyone make you want to worship" or "Do not ... and do not allow yourself worship" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You shall not ... and be drawn away to worship

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh showed you these things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: To you these things were shown

contextId.occurrenceNote: Moses compares Yahweh's anger to someone starting a fire to destroy things. This can be stated in active form. To kindle anger is a metaphor for becoming very angry. Alternate translation: "Yahweh your God will kindle his anger" or "Yahweh your God will become very angry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: the anger of Yahweh your God will be kindled against you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bless you more than I bless any other people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be blessed more than all other peoples

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until you have destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until they are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you have many more things" or "you have many more possessions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all that you have is multiplied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh wrote on them the same words he had said to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: on them was written everything just like all the words that Yahweh announced to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that is where they buried him" or "the Israelites buried him there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there he was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh may cause you and your children to live a long time" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Just like you eat the gazelle and the deer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Like the gazelle and the deer are eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the priest will pour out the blood of the sacrifice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the blood of your sacrifices will be poured out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after Yahweh destroys them before you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after they are destroyed from before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must kill" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the people of the city have done such a terrible thing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that such an abominable thing has been done among you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one must ever rebuild the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it must never be built again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must not eat them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they must not be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because Yahweh has required that you cancel debts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because Yahweh's cancellation of debts has been proclaimed

contextId.occurrenceNote: If a person could not repay their debts, they sometimes sold themselves into slavery to pay what they owed. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "sell themselves to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is sold to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must not have any yeast among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No yeast must be seen among you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will choose them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be taken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If you find someone" or "If there is anyone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If there is found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone tells you about this disobedient act" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if you are told about this

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone has done such a horrible thing in Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: such an abomination has been done in Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There must not be anyone among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: There must not be found among you anyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do this so that family members do not kill an innocent person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Do this so that innocent blood is not shed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will you confirm that the man is guilty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: must any matter be confirmed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the people in the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people who are found in it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If someone finds a person whom someone else has killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If someone is found killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nobody knows who attacked him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is not known who has attacked him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "him whom someone has killed" or "the dead body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: him who has been killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a valley where nobody has plowed the ground or planted seeds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a valley that has been neither plowed nor sown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the heifer whose neck the priests broke" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the heifer whose neck was broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then Yahweh will forgive his people Israel for the death of an innocent person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then the bloodshed will be forgiven them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when you took her captive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when she was taken captive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: Possible meanings are 1) "the man loves one of his wives and he hates the other wife" or 2) "the man loves one wife more than he loves the other wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one is loved and the other is hated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if the firstborn son belongs to the wife whom the man hates" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the firstborn son is of her that is hated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you execute him" or "you kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "because God curses everyone whom people hang on trees" and 2) "people hang on trees those whom God has cursed." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for whoever is hanged is cursed by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the man did not find proof that the girl was a virgin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that the proof of virginity was not found in the girl

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If someone finds a man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If a man is found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if somebody finds out what happened" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if they are discovered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and no one is to force him to live away from his home and do any kind of work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: neither may he be commanded to go on any forced duty

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all of the instructions that I have given you and that the priests, who are Levites, teach you to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every instruction given to you which the priests, the Levites, teach you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must not execute the parents because of something bad that one of their children did" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The parents must not be put to death for their children

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, Alternate translation: "and you must not execute the children because of something bad that their parents did" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: neither must the children be put to death for their parents

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you should only execute a person because of something bad that he did himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everyone must be put to death for his own sin

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If the judge orders them to beat the guilty man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If the guilty man deserves to be beaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he will watch them beat him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be beaten in his presence

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "then the judge would humiliate your fellow Israelite in front of all of the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then your fellow Israelite would be humiliated before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "then the family of the dead man must not let the widow marry someone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then the wife of the dead man must not be married off to someone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the statement the Levites must shout to all the people of Israel. It may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the person ... sets it up in secret" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed ... sets it up in secret

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 27:16](../27/16.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 27:16](../27/16.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 27:16](../27/16.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 27:16](../27/16.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 27:16](../27/16.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the man be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will bless you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed will you be

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will bless" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed will be

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "cause you to defeat the armies that attack you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: cause your enemies who rise up against you to be struck down before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will curse you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Cursed will you be

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will curse" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Cursed will be

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until your enemies destroy you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until you are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until it destroys you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until you are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will cause your enemies to strike you down" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh will cause you to be struck down before your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The peoples of the other nations will drive you from one nation to another" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "from which no one will be able to heal you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from which you cannot be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will watch as someone kills your ox" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your ox will be slain before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone will take your donkey by force and will not give it back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your donkey will be forcibly taken away from before you and will not be restored to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will give your sheep to your enemies" or "I will allow your enemies to take your sheep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your sheep will be given to your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will give your sons and your daughters to other peoples" or "Your enemies will take your sons and daughters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your sons and your daughters will be given to other peoples

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that no one will be able to cure" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from which you cannot be cured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until they destroy you" or "until they leave you with nothing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until you are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until he has destroyed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until you are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where no one can sow seed and the crops do not bear fruit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where nothing is sown or bears fruit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he has revealed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will devour them" or "I will allow their enemies to devour them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be devoured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "their descendants will not forget to keep it in their mouths" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated positively. Alternate translation: "their descendants will remember to keep it in their mouths" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idiom "forget it from the mouth" means to stop speaking about it. Alternate translation: "their descendants will not stop speaking about it to each other" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I start a fire because I am angry, and it burns ... it is devouring ... it is setting" or "when I am angry, I destroy my enemies like a fire, and I destroy everything on earth and in ... I devour ... I set" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a fire is kindled by my anger and is burning ... it is devouring ... it is setting

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The abstract noun "hunger" can be translated as the verb "be hungry." Alternate translation: "They will grow weak and die because they are hungry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be wasted by hunger

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings of "burning heat" are 1) the Israelites will suffer from fevers or 2) the weather will be unusually hot during a drought or famine. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They will ... hunger, and burning heat and terrible disasters will devour them" or "They will ... hunger, and they will die from burning heat and terrible disasters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will ... hunger and devoured by burning heat and bitter destruction

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Moses is referring to the members of the tribe of Benjamin. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The ones whom Yahweh loves live" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The one loved by Yahweh lives

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 33:13](../33/13.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh bless his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May his land be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 33:13](../33/13.md). Alternate translation: "May Yahweh bless his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May his land be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can stated in active form. Alternate translation: Possible meanings are 1) "May Yahweh bless Gad and give him much land to live in" or 2) "People should say that Yahweh is good because he has given Gad much land to live in" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed be he who enlarges Gad
